description: Luxemburg is restricting social movement to essential acitivities, including grocery shopping, essential travel to work, way to hospital, in order to visit people in need, in an emergency situation and in order to exercise (with 2 meters distance).
Luxemburg has established, from October 30, a curfew from 11 pm to 6 am, exceptions made for major forces, working, or doctor checking.
Initially, Luxemburg has established, a curfew from 11 pm to 6 am, starting from October 30. With Prime Minister Bettel's new announcement on November 23, the curfew has been extended to December 15.
link: NA ; https://5minutes.rtl.lu/actu/luxembourg/a/1618380.html ; RTL ; Xavier Bettel: "C'est un coup de frein nécessaire"

description: Luxemburg has established, from October 30, a curfew from 11 pm to 6 am, exceptions made for major forces, working, or doctor checking. Luxemburg's original curfew from 11 pm to 6 am, which was set to last until November 30, has been extended to January 15, 2021, starting on December 14.
link: NA ; https://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-actu/covid-19-restrictions-prolongees-jusqu-au-15-janvier-au-luxembourg-20201209 ; Le Figaro ; Covid-19 : restrictions prolongées jusqu'au 15 janvier au Luxembourg

description: Luxemburg is declaring a state of crisis on 17 March, which gives the Government the possibility to set up emergency measures in order to face the crisis. Thus, a regulatory and legal framework is established, in line with the Luxembourg Constitution: the scope covered by this Article is limited to measures which cannot be taken in good time through the normal legislative procedure. The Chamber of Deputies can, at every moment, suspend or revoke the state of crisis: Parliamentary control is this fully guaranteed.

German frontier workers are excempt from the Luxemburg entry ban. The Luxembourg government has issued a certificate the worker needs to carry with them, as proof of the need to cross the border. 18 March.
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Luxemburg banned third-country nationals to enter the territory of the Grand Duchy. The restriction was put in place, initially, for a one month period starting on March 18, 2020.  There are several exemptions from this ban, including for  Belgian, French, and German cross-border workers.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: French frontier workers are excempt from the Luxemburg entry ban. description: Luxemburg: Since 15 June, there have been no more controls at Luxembourg's borders with the 3 border countries.

Luxemburg is enforcing bans on third-country nationals to enter the territory. Exceptions are made for citizens of the EU and associated with the Schengen area, along with residents of those following third countries: Australia, Japan, New Zealand, Rwanda, South Korea, Singapore, Thailand, Uruguay, China/Hong Kong/ Macao
Luxemburg is opening three specified medical centres for patients with coronavirus symptoms on 18. March.

Luxemburg bans all stationary visits in hospitals, all essential vitis need to be processed with higthened health security measures. Planned hospital acitivies are recommended to be canceled and staff is recommended to cancel leave.

Luxemburg bans all stationary visits in hospitals, all essential vitis need to be processed with higthened health security measures. Planned hospital acitivies are recommended to be canceled and staff is recommended to cancel leave.

description: 20.6. Luxembourg wants to prevent a second wave of corona with comprehensive tests of the entire population.

Luxemburg announces that from 24 March onwards the RGTR bus lines 158 Kirchberg - Remich - Merzig (D) and 159 Luxembourg - Losheim (D) will be diverted via Schengen, then Besch, to Nennig. From then on the routes remain unchanged. Nennig Zoll is replaced by Nennig Bahnhof.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
target_city: 58 Kirchberg – Remich – Merzig (D) und 159 Luxemburg – Losheim (D),Schengen, dann Besch, nach Nennig

description: Luxembourg: Retirement and nursing homes - family visits no longer prohibited, sanitary restrictions stay in place
Luxemburg is recommending risk groups to reduce social interaction, travel and avoiding mass gatherings and hospital visits.
type_text: The Luxemburg government has issued official recommendations for risk groups to avoid travel, social gatherings, shopping at rush hours and public transport.

description: Luxemburg is recommending a visitors ban on care homes to all relatives and friends of residents of elderly homes.
type_text: Luxemburg recommended to implement a visitors ban in all elderly homes.

description: Luxembourg: Covid-19: Introduction of family support leave
type_text: As part of the government's measures to limit the spread of coronavirus, paid leave was introduced to support the family. This leave is intended to help private sector workers and self-employed persons who are forced to stop working due to the closure of an institution for people with a disability or for elderly people, so that they can care for an adult with a disability or for an elderly person living in their household.

description: Luxembourg: COVID-19: New procedure for applying for short-time work in cases of force majeure due to the COVID-19 crisis announced on March 27.
type_text: In order to preserve jobs and thus prevent redundancies, Luxembourg labour law provides for various regulations on short-time working. Short-time work enables companies to keep well-trained and experienced employees in employment even in times of crisis.

description: Luxemburg announced the reopening of visits to care and health homes in Luxembourg in a 28th April press conference. However, the respect of hygiene rules remains essential with numerous rules to keep the social distance.
type_text: Reopening families to go back visiting people in care homes

description: Luxemburg, through its Minister for Family and Integration, announced the reopening of visits to care and health homes to families on a Tuesday 28th April press conference. The timing of the openings depends on care homes' managers.
type_text: Luxemburg recommended to implement a visitors ban in all elderly homes.
The Policy sets out repayable financial aid to compensate for temporary financial difficulties caused by the COVID-19 crisis in Luxembourg
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Luxembourg: Partial unemployment extended until end of 2020
type_text: The government and unions have reached an agreement to support businesses through partial unemployment.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)
link: https://today.rtl.lu/news/luxembourg/a/1532390.html ; August applications need to be filed by 12 July

description: On 24 August 2020, Luxembourg and Belgium have agreed to extend until 31 December 2020 the amicable agreement of 19 May 2020 on the situation for cross-border workers within the context of combating the spread of Covid-19 concerning remoting work.
Luxembourg has extended the partial unemployment, initially scheduled for the end of 2020, until June 2021
type_text: The government and unions have reached an agreement to support businesses through partial unemployment.

description: The Luxemburg Ministry of Health is starting a public health awareness campaigns surrounding COVID-19 on 29.92.2020.

Luxemburg is restricting non-essential business from 16 March onwards with the expection of grocery stores, pharmacies, other kinds of food shops and opptricians, pet food shops, telecom shops, fuel stations, shops for health equipment, night shops, kiosks.

description: Luxemburg bans public gatherings in closed rooms with over 100 people and in open spaces with over 500 people.
Luxemburg is banning all social, cultural, festive, political and sportive activities from 16 March onwards for the entire public.
Luxemburg withdraws the initial ban on all social, cultural, festive, political, and sportive activities from May 29.
Luxembourg: Private meetings are limited to 10 persons
Luxemburg is strengthening public gatherings numbers, as those are limited to 100 people inside and outside from October 30.
Luxemburg is reinforcing the number of people possible to meet in private meetings, previously limited to 10 people but now been reduced to 4 people from the 30th October until 31st December 2020.
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
link: NA ; https://covid19.public.lu/en/sanitary-measures/gatherings.html ; Luxemburg's official Coronavirus Website ; Public and Private Gatherings

description: Luxemburg is launching a new online shopping platform for risk groups on 19 March in order to support people who cannot and should not leave their homes to buy essentials goods. The platform offers a delivery service.
